content: Compared to the fourth quarter of last year, total GAAP costs and expenses were approximately $3.1 million lower, which was mainly due to a $2.3 million decrease in R&D due primarily to an approximately $1.5 million decrease in stock comp expense and a $390,000 decrease in payroll expense and also a decrease of approximately $1.4 million in sales and marketing, due primarily to an approximately $950,000 decrease in stock comp expense and a $230,000 decrease in payroll expense.
